content.raw:
I like this behaviour, but I think it will cause discrepancies when loading models which have both materials and colors set. For example:

1. Enter model editor, insert a box and open its inspector

1. Change material script to `Gazebo/Red` and write 1 on all blue color components

1. Apply -> Preview shows up blue-ish.

1. Save & Exit -> saved model shows up blue-ish

1. Edit model again -> Preview shows up blue-ish.

1. Open inspector,  material appears as Gazebo/Red, but blue color components are not 1.

1. Apply without changing anything -> preview becomes red

1. Save & Exit -> saved model is also red.

I like this behaviour, but I think it will cause discrepancies when loading models which have both materials and colors set. For example:

  1. Enter model editor, insert a box and open its inspector

  2. Change material script to Gazebo/Red and write 1 on all blue color components

  3. Apply -> Preview shows up blue-ish.

  4. Save & Exit -> saved model shows up blue-ish

  5. Edit model again -> Preview shows up blue-ish.

  6. Open inspector, material appears as Gazebo/Red, but blue color components are not 1.

  7. Apply without changing anything -> preview becomes red

  8. Save & Exit -> saved model is also red.
